instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.EDP_BKLT_EN: What is EDP_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “EDP_BKLT” which stands for “embedded displayport backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: mac book air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  flashing blinking back light
threads.message: Hi, I have and mac book air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with blinking, flashing display I measure <TRANSISTOR>Q7707</TRANSISTOR> where I found pin 5 voltage going in and out from 3.3 to.09 soi change the  backlight driver and all its resistor around it  am still getting flashing backlight I check <RESISTOR>R7789</RESISTOR> and  <RESISTOR>R7788</RESISTOR> and the resistance is good I replace the LCD display with another good working one still the same problem even change the LCD cable still problem remains I measure led return for 0 ohms and there good  please help thanks.

threads.title: mac book air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  flashing blinking back light
threads.message: If <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> is fluctuating the why mess with all the things you did? Replacing <TRANSISTOR>Q7707</TRANSISTOR> would be the first thing in this case.

threads.title: mac book air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  flashing blinking back light
threads.message: Hi duke I replace <TRANSISTOR>Q7707</TRANSISTOR> and still, the backlight is flashing on and off.

threads.title: mac book air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  flashing blinking back light
threads.message: Disconnect IO board cable to rule out <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is being pulled low.

threads.title: mac book air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  flashing blinking back light
threads.message: okay that did it io board cable making <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> low so now i need to replacing the cable right

threads.title: mac book air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  flashing blinking back light
threads.message: Yeah, common failure. Have some of them in stock, will happen again. Same for the IO boards.
